qas.question: Of Africa what rank in size country is Mali?

answers.text: Mali is the eighth-largest country in Africa

qas.question: What are two major rivers located inside of Mali?
Besides salt what other major natural resources does Mali produce?
More than half of the population is what religion?
What is the eighth largest country in the world?
What country has an area of 1,240,000 mi.²?
What desert does Mali just touch the edge of?
What is basal agriculture in deep-sea fishing?

context: Mali (i/ˈmɑːli/; French: [maˈli]), officially <b5_0><b7_0>the Republic of Mali<b7_0/><b5_0/> (French: République du Mali), is a landlocked country in <b6_0>West<b6_0/> Africa. <a0_0>Mali is the eighth-largest country in Africa<a0_0/>, with an area of just over 1,240,000 square kilometres (480,000 sq mi). The population of Mali is 14.5 million. Its capital is <a1_0>Bamako<a1_0/>. Mali consists of eight regions and its borders on the north reach deep into the middle of the <b8_0>Sahara Desert,<b8_0/> while the country's southern part, where the majority of inhabitants live, features the <a2_0>Niger and Senegal rivers<a2_0/>. <b9_0>The country's economy<b9_0/> centers on agriculture and fishing. Some of Mali's <a3_0>prominent natural resources include gold<a3_0/>, being the third largest producer of gold in the African continent, and salt. About half the population lives below the international poverty line of $1.25 (U.S.) a day. A majority of the population <a4_0>(55%) are non-denominational Muslims<a4_0/>.
